author: sky.cactus
content: Can you help explain the attack this mitigates?

author: sky.cactus
content: It feels like if one wants to include a transaction at a later date, one could just submit the transaction at a later date.

author: potuz
content: The basic idea is that you withhold a block, say for slot n. Wait a few seconds and you see n+1 and n+2 arrive (based on n-1). You then release block n based also on n-1, including the transactions of n+1 and n+2. If for some reason your block n becomes the canonical head, you just stole the MEV in n+1 and n+2.

author: potuz
content: If you on the other hand are not allowed to include most transactions on n+1 and n+2 cause they were released after your slot n, then there's very little incentive except grieving the network, for you to try this
